title: Spread of iron in sub-Saharan Africa

content.question: A historian researching the timeline of the spread of iron metallurgy in sub-Saharan Africa would find which of the following sources most useful?

choices.label: Bantu-language oral histories transmitted through generations
Archaeological evidence of early forges and smelting operations
European travelers’ accounts from the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries describing African industrial practices
North African Muslim merchants’ account books detailing purchases of iron tools

content.answer: Archaeological evidence of early forges and smelting operations

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
